result.execSummary:
The defendant Megan S. McKenney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Payment of DNA and Domestic Abuse Surcharge- payment to be worked out with agent.
No possession or consumption of alcohol or any controlled substance without a valid Rx. No contact with the victim without prior agent approval.

Maintain/obtain full time employment. Any assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent. Take all prescribed medications and only as prescribed. DNA Sample Due: September 13, 2022. Payment of restitution if claim is made. Bond to be applied to Atty for any Dean fees- if there is a balance, balance to be applied to any of the remaining fines, costs, fees, and/or DNA Surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Megan S. McKenney

10:26 AM Prosecuting attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Megan S. McKenney in court.  Attorney William Reabe in court for Megan S. McKenney. 
Court calls cases 22CF20 and 22CM6. 
Atty spks- case has been resolved. 
Atty provides plea form.
Atty provides Deferred Judgment Agreement. 
DA heard on agreement.
Atty agrees.
DA reads charge on Count 1 in 22CF20.
Court arraigns Deft.
Deft enters Guilty Plea.
DA reads charge on Count 2 in 22CF20.
Court arraigns Deft.
Deft enters Guilty Plea. 
DA reads charge on Count 3 in 22CF20.
Court arraigns Deft.
Deft enters Guilty Plea.
DA reads charge on Count 1 in 22CM6.
Court arraigns Deft.
Deft enters Guilty Plea. 
Non-citizen advisory.
Elements of offense.
PleaQuest/WOR.
Constitutional rights.
Deft understands.
Atty satisfied.
Factual basis.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea on Count 1 in 22CF20, but withholds findings of guilt pursuant to the Deferred Judgment Agreement. 
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea and finds deft guilty on Count 2 and Count 3 in 22CF20 and Count 1 in 22CM6. 
DA heard on sentencing.
Atty heard on sentencing.
Deft heard.
Court heard on factors.
Court withholds sentence on Count 2 in 22CF20, and places deft on probation for 2 years. 
Conditions of Probation: 
90 days conditional jail time, without good time but with huber if in compliance with jail rules and regulations. 
Deft to report to the MCJ no later than 7pm on September 13, 2022. 
Credit for 8 days time served. 
Payment of $100 fine + costs + fees + DNA Surcharge- payment to be worked out with agent. 
Payment of restitution if claim is made. 
No possession or consumption of alcohol or any controlled substance without a valid Rx. 
No contact with the victim without prior agent approval. 
Maintain/ obtain full time employment. 
Any assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent. 
Take all prescribed medications and only as prescribed.

08:48 AM Defendant Megan S. McKenney in court.  DeShea D. Morrow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court calls case. 
Deft is being heard- has had another court case with Atty. Raebe but has not discussed this case with him. 
Does not have his contact information. 
Court reviews charges and maximum penalties. 
Advises Deft that attorney needs to be present before she is able to make any decisions.
Atty Christensen spks- Atty Raebe will be be here in the afternoon and she will advise Atty Raebe to contact deft. 
DA is being heard on signature bond. 
Deft heard and has no objections- provides updated address to the court. 
Court imposes $500.00 signature bond, sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances w/o a valid Rx. and no contact with J.W. or his residence.
